contentMeta.description: The format type of tournament or tournament phase: group, elimination, etc.

concept.name: hosted
hosted
concept.definition: For a tournament that holds stages in different locations. Eg. different host cities/countries for PGA, FIS, Diamond League (IAAF) and even Tour de France

concept.name: single-group
single-group
concept.definition: The stage involves only a single group of competitors. For example Italian Serie A where teams vie for placement in the league table. Also, a single group competition in a multi-group stage, such as the World Cup group stage.

concept.name: series
series
concept.definition: A stage in which two competitors face off in a series of games (eg. best 3 of 5) the winner of which proceeds to the next stage, or wins the tournament.

concept.name: single-elimination
single-elimination
concept.definition: A stage in which two competitors face off in a single match to determine who proceeds to the next stage, or wins the tournament. Eg. elimination stage of World Cup of Soccer or NFL playoffs.

concept.name: home-and-home
home-and-home
concept.definition: A stage in which two competitors face off in a two matches (or legs) at each team's home location. The overall winner proceeds ahead. Usually culiminates in a single-elimination match at a neutral location i.e. UEFA Champions League.
